Siddiqi) 177146 Co-op Work Term Posted: 2026 - Summer App Deadline Application Method: Posting Goes Live: Job Posting Status: 01/26/2026 09:00 AM Through UBC Science Co-op 01/14/2026 03:06 PM Approved ORGANIZATION INFORMATION Organization Address Line 1 City Postal Code / Zip Code Province / State Country Sanofi-Pasteur Inc. 1755 Steeles Ave W North York M2R 3T4 ON Canada JOB POSTING INFORMATION Placement Term <b> Job Title <b> Position Type Job Location Country Duration Work Mode Salary Currency Salary Salary Range $ Job Description 2026 - Summer S26 Co-Op Student - Digital Strategy (A. Siddiqi) 177146 Co-op Position Toronto, ON Canada 12 months Hybrid CAD 55000.0 per year for 37.5 Major List 55000-65000 per year https://jobs.sanofi.com/en/job/toronto/sanofi-canada-co-op-university-recruitment-program/2649/33894754496 Salary: Bachelor's Degree $55,000 base annual salary+ sign-on of $2,000 Masters Degree $65,000 base annual salary + sign-on of $2,000 Job title: Co-Op Student - Digital Strategy • Entity: Corporate Functions - Sanofi Vaccines Limited Location: AI CENTRE of EXCELLENCE (Digital Data Hub) 240 Richmond Street West, Toronto, ON, Canada • <Hybrid> Duration: 12 months: May 2026 - April 2027 • Note: Candidates must be available 37.5 hours per week, Monday-Friday About the job Looking to launch your career at the cutting edge of healthcare? Join Sanofi for a chance to develop with mentoring and guidance from inspirational leaders while helping to make an impact on the lives of countless people worldwide. As Co-Op Student - Digital Strategy in our Digital Strategy Department, you will learn to perform and support daily functions. Digital Strategy and Operations (DS&O) at Sanofi is the innovation engine that enables the digital transformation and innovation of the company globally. We leverage data to tackle business challenges, working in global teams to find solutions that are not afraid of challenging the status quo. As part of this team, you will fully immerse yourself in data collection, draw insights from analysis, and develop compelling, synthesized recommendations. We are an innovative global healthcare company with one purpose: to chase the miracles of science to improve people's lives. We're also a company where you can flourish and grow your career, with countless opportunities to explore, make connections with people, and stretch the limits of what you thought was possible. Ready to get started? Main responsibilities: Strategic Planning and Execution Support: • Develop and implement strategic initiatives that align with the company's digital transformation goals. • Conduct analysis to identify opportunities for operational improvements and drive strategic projects. Present final recommendations to internal stakeholders. • Data-Driven Decision Making and Insight Generation: • Leverage data analytics to inform and support business decisions. Develop and maintain dashboards and reports to track key performance indicators (KPIs). • Product Strategy and Innovation: • Partner with Product Owners, Data Engineers, and Data Scientists to design and develop novel solutions. • Support product owners in outlining product milestones and resources to meet product release plans. • Conduct analyses to identify root causes of potential problems and develop remediation plans. Improve product adoption, collect user feedback, and enrich product feature backlogs. • Why choose us? • Bring the miracles of science to life alongside a supportive, future-focused team. • Discover endless opportunities to grow your talent and drive your career, whether it's through a promotion or lateral move, at home or internationally. Enjoy a thoughtful, well-crafted rewards package that recognizes your contribution and amplifies your impact. • Pursue Progress. Discover Extraordinary. Progress doesn't happen without people - people from different backgrounds, in different locations, doing different roles, all united by one thing: a desire to make miracles happen. You can be one of those people. Chasing change, embracing new ideas and exploring all the opportunities we have to offer. Let's pursue progress. And let's discover extraordinary together. At Sanofi, we provide equal opportunities to all regardless of race, color, ancestry, religion, sex, national origin, sexual orientation, age, citizenship, marital status, disability, or gender identity. Watch our ALL IN video and check out our Diversity Equity and Inclusion actions at sanofi.com! Job Requirements About you • Must be currently enrolled as a student at an accredited university, in an accredited Co-Op program and have completed at least one year of study. • Education: Working towards a degree - Bachelors or Masters in the field of Business, Technology, or Science (e.g., BCom, MBA, M.Eng, MMA/MMAI). • Minimum GPA of 3.0 on a 4.0 scale or 8.0 on a 12.0 scale • Technical skills: Proficient in use of MS Office, including Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint, and Word • Strong interest in learning new technology, willingness to upskill in tech, and openness to learning new tools. • Comfort with ambiguity, quick learning ability, and a motivation to use technology to make impacts. • Ability to work independently and collaboratively. • Results-driven mentality, inspired by new ideas, and continuously striving for excellence. • Strong organizational and project coordination skills, attention to detail, and strong communication skills. • Willing to push the status quo and challenge the traditional way of doing things. Work Authorization: Must be legally entitled to work for Sanofi in Canada for the duration of the assignment. • Citizenship Requirement N/A APPLICATION INFORMATION Application Procedure Through UBC Science Co-op Cover Letter Required? Yes Address Cover Letter to Arif Siddiqi Special Application Instructions Application Instructions: • Apply through your school's career services website As a required part of Sanofi's application process, please also apply through our website following the steps below: • You may apply to multiple positions through your school career portal, however, only ONE profile is required on our Sanofi website. 1. 2. 3. Go to Working at Sanofi Search R2833772 and select "Sanofi Canada Co-Op University Recruitment Program" Click "Apply" and follow steps to apply online Students are required to apply through Sanofi's Career portal using their Legal First and Last Name; if they have a preferred name they can include this in parenthesis i.e. Legal first name (preferred name).
